greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the index of the column in A265901 where n appears; also the index of the row in A265903 where n appears.
comment: If all 1's are deleted, the remaining terms are the sequence incremented. - after _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_ Oct 05 2006 comment in A051135.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
T. Kubo and R. Vakil, On Conway's recursive sequence, Discr. Math. 152 (1996), 225-252.
example: Illustration how the sequence can be constructed by concatenating the frequency counts Q_n of each successive level n of A004001-tree:
The above illustration copied from the page 229 of Kubo and Vakil paper (page 5 in PDF).
xref: Essentially same as A051135 apart from the initial term, which here is set as a(1)=1.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 09 2016
